alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:30PM EST until January 12 at 4:33PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Milledgeville affecting Wilkinson, Baldwin and Washington Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River at Milledgeville. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Moderate flooding continues to expand further into the woodlands and pastures along the river. Fishing Creek continues to back up and spread further into woodland areas and cover some roads. Some structures near the creek will begin to flood. Tanyard Branch Stream continues to flood. Sinclair Dam will likely have six gates open to reach this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 34.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.2 feet on 02/25/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM EST.
